intro: Tenaxia stricta, commonly known as the rigid tenaxia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers. Tenaxia stricta is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
